Additional explosions in the area of the dam. HIMARS have now hit it. More drones are flying in its direction.
After Ukrainian HIMARS rockets and Darts drones struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam, the spillway has begun letting water out of the reservoir, leading to a significant reduction in the water level.
After Ukrainian HIMARS rockets and Darts drones struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam, the spillway has begun letting water out of the reservoir, leading to a significant reduction in the water level.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Novoselivka, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~295.
Total land area: ~0.92 km¬≤.
Russia has now added thunderstorms to their arsenal of weapons, and is using lightning to strike Ukrainian energy infrastructure in Kryvyi Rih.
For those wondering, there are no standard signs of a missile attack tonight. Gerans will just do their usual thing.

It seems the Russians have once again changed tactics when preparing their attacks - at least for now. This, plus the possible usage of Tu-22m3s in the next attack makes predicting it a bit more complicated.
Also, it's worth noting, on November 1 Russia will switch to their winter frequencies for combat operations involving Tu-95MS and Tu-160 strategic bombers, although hopefully this shouldn't impact the ability to track movements too much.
Mobile fire crews have been deployed to the Kremlin due to the threat of UAVs for Moscow.

All airports in Moscow have been temporarily closed due to the threat of UAVs. Su-34, Su-35, MiG-29, Tu-160, and Tu-95MS aircraft have been evacuated and are currently airborne, waiting for the threat to be over.
Tu-95MS and Tu-160s are now being evacuated from Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, due to the threat of UAVs for the region.
After Ukrainian HIMARS rockets and Darts drones struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam, the spillway has begun letting water out of the reservoir, leading to a significant reduction in the water level.
Water continues to rush from the Belgorod Reservoir Dam following the Ukrainian strikes, and is flooding the surrounding areas.

Large numbers of Ukrainian UAVs continue to be shot down across western Russia, including in Moscow Oblast. It seems Russia was ready for this attack due to yesterday's attempts to strike the capital. 
There are still no confirmed impacts. The fire seen burning in Moscow is from a forest fire caused by downed drone debris and the small fire at the oil depot is unrelated to the attack. The explosions heard over Moscow have been from air defence operations.

Information from the ground.
Russian forces are operating in the Freight terminals in Lyman
Edit* 'This has effectively cut off the loop around the town'

Large numbers of Ukrainian UAVs continue to be shot down across western Russia, including in Moscow Oblast. It seems Russia was ready for this attack due to yesterday's attempts to strike the capital.   There are still no confirmed impacts. The fire seen burning‚Ä¶

These are the approximate flight routes of the hundreds of Ukrainian UAVs that have attacked/are attacking Russia tonight. 
UAVs were launched from Dnipropetrovsk, Poltava, Donetsk, Sumy, Kharkiv, Chernihiv, and Kyiv Oblasts. There are still no confirmed impacts, despite the massive numbers of drones used.

These are the approximate flight routes of the hundreds of Ukrainian UAVs that have attacked/are attacking Russia tonight.   UAVs were launched from Dnipropetrovsk, Poltava, Donetsk, Sumy, Kharkiv, Chernihiv, and Kyiv Oblasts. There are still no confirmed‚Ä¶
There are also unconfirmed reports of Ukrainian Flamingo cruise missiles being shot down over Oryol Oblast, but take that with a grain of salt for now.

Around 98% of Ukrainian long-range UAVs get shot down by Russian air defence / EW. Ukraine often launches hundreds at a time just for a couple to get through.   The drones that do get through (usually only 1 or 2 each day), and that hit refineries do minor‚Ä¶

Yesterday, Ukraine launched more than 150 UAVs at Moscow and other Russian regions. Every single drone was intercepted by Russian air defence or electronic warfare.
This is what I mean when I talk about a "98% interception rate".
Russian VKS-affiliated channel Fighterbomber reports the loss of a Russian Ka-52 attack helicopter and its two crew members. The details of the crash are currently unknown.

The Ukrainian SOF published footage showing FP-2 drone strikes on a fuel depot used by the Russian Armed Forces in Starobilsk, Luhansk Oblast, as well as an oil base in Luhansk City. 
Fuel depot 
coordinates
: 49.290321, 38.926589
Oil base 
coordinates
: 48.5121694, 39.3129035

Russia has attempted a fourth large-scale mechanised assault on the Shakhove salient in the Dobropillya direction.
6 groups of 4-5 vehicles advanced down separate routes, attempting to complicate Ukrainian attempts at repelling it with drones and artillery. This proved more successful than previous tactics, as only around half of the equipment was damaged or destroyed this time. Additionally, poorer weather conditions provided some level of cover for them.  
Russian infantry was able to dismount in several areas, and the Ukrainians are attempting to clear them with drones and small assault groups. The levels of success from this attack will become clearer in the coming days.
Ukrainian UAVs are flying to Moscow Oblast for the third night in a row. Airports have once again begun to close, with strategic bombers and tactical aircraft being evacuated.
Ukrainian UAVs are flying to Moscow Oblast for the third night in a row. Airports have once again begun to close, with strategic bombers and tactical aircraft being evacuated.

By the way, I think I should mention that when Russia carries out its next large-scale, combined missile attack on Ukraine this week, it is not in response to Ukraine's drone attacks on Moscow.
Russian preparations for this attack were delayed due to their scheduled nuclear exercises. But the attack date is largely set in stone and was planned well in advance of Ukraine beginning their attacks. Russia doesn't really do "retaliatory strikes". 
The individual Iskander-M strikes are usually opportunistic, targeting something which has just been discovered, while the larger, more coordinated attacks are planned beforehand, targeting static targets such as Ukraine's energy infrastructure, their military-industrial complex, and airfields.

Israel Accuses Iranian Leader Of Plotting Attacks On Jewish Sites As It Manufactures Case For New War
Israel‚Äôs Mossad spy agency on October 26 accused Iran‚Äôs Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) of orchestrating a string of recent attacks on Jewish sites in Western countries, in what appears to be an attempt to manufacture a cease for a new war with the Islamic Republic.
A statement by the agency named Sardar Ammar, a senior commander of the IRGC‚Äôs external operations branch known as the Quds Force, as the mastermind behind the attacks.
It said that the force intensified its efforts to attack Jewish and Israeli sites around the world since the October 7, 2023, Hamas attack on Israel, alleging that Ammar commands some 11,000 operatives in carrying out covert operations.
üëâ

Russian Army Captures Three Towns On Yangchur River Amid Ukrainian Collapse
On October 27, the Russian military captured three settlements between Dnepropetrovsk and Zaporizhzhia along the Yanchur River amid an apparently Ukrainian collapse.
In Dnepropetrovsk, the Vostok [East] Group of Forces captured Yegorovka, according to the Russian Ministry of Defense. The attack on the settlement was led by the 64th Separate Guards Motor Rifle Brigade, which advanced from Pryvillya, clearing some seven square kilometers along the way.
From Yegorovka, Russian troops will be able to attack Vyshneve to the north, from a new direction. The settlement will likely be captured within a few days.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Cuts Key Road Between Krasny Liman And Seversk 
On October 27, the Russian military cut a key road linking the cities of Krasny Liman and Seversk in the Donetsk direction, putting more pressure on Kiev forces.
The road was reportedly blocked by the Yug [South] Group of Forces in the Medovy Forest, close to Dibrova to the south of Krasny Liman. This means that Russian troops may be situated around one kilometer, or even less, from the southern entrance of the city.
While the road was cut close to Krasny Liman, Kiev forces in Seversk took the bigger hit. Without the road, sending supplies to the city will be far more complicated. It‚Äôs worth noting that the city is already facing much pressure from Russian troops, who are advancing to the north and south of it.
üëâ

There's More Than Meets The Eye: The TRC-Criminal Nexus - A Dual Threat To Ukrainian Civilians
Criminal elements have infiltrated the Ukrainian mobilisation system. Representatives of the untouchable caste are blackmailing, extorting, beating and murdering peaceful Ukrainian citizens. The risk of ending up on the front line and dying has increased, creating new challenges.
For the first time, the Ukrainian Parliament has begun to acknowledge the scale and nature of the problem. Yuriy Kamelchuk, a Member of Parliament, stated outright that no video recording is made in 99% of cases of aggressive actions by TRC representatives against citizens.
The situation is exacerbated by rampant crime committed under the guise of official structures. The Member of Parliament notes individuals posing as TRC employees.
These organised criminals, he says, stuff people into minibuses and extort ransoms, taking advantage of the general chaos of mobilisation.
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Al-Suwayda Druze Leader Demands ‚ÄòIndependence‚Äô From Syria, Laying Ground For Israeli Invasion
The spiritual leader of the Druze community in Syria, Hikmat al-Hajri, said on October 27 that self-determination for the people of al-Suwayda is ‚Äúan absolute right that cannot be revoked‚Äù, stressing that his vision is based on the ‚Äúcomplete independence‚Äù of the governorate.
Druze armed factions backed the Islamist rebel offensive that overthrew the regime of former President Bashar al-Assad last December, but later refused to allow the forces of the country‚Äôs new Islamist-led Interim Government to enter al-Suwayda, maintaining a form of autonomy over the governorate.
In July a battle broke out in al-Suwayda, when an intervention by government forces to end a local conflict involving bedouins quickly escalated into an all-out, sectarian-fueled attack on the Druze. Israel, which vowed to protect the community after the fall of the Assad regime, eventually intervened...
üëâ

In Video: New Russian Automated Gun Takes Down Ukrainian Drones
The Russian military began fielding a deeply modernized drone hunter version of the ZU-23-2 23 mm twin-barreled autocannon, which was developed by the Soviet Union in the 1950s.
On October 27, video footage of one such autocannon engaging several Ukrainian long-range, fixed-wing drones surfaced online. It is unclear when or where exactly the footage was taken, but it clearly shows the autocannon taking down at least four drones.
The autocannon is likely based on the same system shown to Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia, during his recent visit to the Kapustin Yar test site.
üëâ
